content: This one is a bit last minute before I depart for the weekend, so please expect / feel free to fix problems. :-)

Could I have assistance from someone with this failure:

reviewdog: fail to get diff: GET https://api.github.com/repos/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pulls/11735: 406 Sorry, the diff exceeded the maximum number of files (300). Consider using 'List pull requests files' API or locally cloning the repository instead. [{Resource:PullRequest Field:diff Code:too_large Message:}]

It seems like this will be a general problem for any large PR.
Scott, I do not know what is going on, but I simply shook the nightly and everything seems to work: here is the PR #11739.
I merged to #11735. Feel free to push directly to these branches. :-)
It seems that #11735 is still unhappy because reviewdog can't cope with such a large diff.

I can see the nightly with the error, but my branch off it had no issues: there is something that I do not understand. I don't have time to investigate this, but will look into reducing the input/output of reviewdog to something manageable.
I tried this a bit, but I really cannot understand why the bump/nightly PR has problems, but branches that come out of it do not. I do not know how to debug this.
If we have .def back, should I revert the change on master?
@Ruben Van de Velde, up to you. It will reduce the diff, but it's also possible to just revert it as part of bump/*.
I closed #11735, and we having to make enought further changes for 2024-04-01 that I don't think it's worthwhile keeping both afloat.
